creditline: Collection of Yvonne and Gabriel P. Weisberg
description: cat. 36; indoor scene with three women, two churning butter near fire, one on R with mixing bowl; gold trim; beige paper; grey mat; black wood frame with gold trim
text:
Charles Milcendeau rejected the traditional academic route to success and spent most of his time in his native region of the Vend√©e, living in the small village of Soullans. There he found suitable models for compositions of daily life like this scene of women making butter in their modest rural home. Even early in his career,
when he was working in Paris, he would return home to sketch and paint the  peasants.
title: Making Butter
